messages.message: this message is slightly confusing. I’m not really sure how to remedy this and I’m guessing some users won’t even necessarily understand what a default drive is?
i know for build we pop up a dialog to migrate your project to the new location but maybe that functionality was hard to implement on converse?
yeah just saying that I think the copy is a little confusing here cc <!subteam^S03F4G5MV1N>
We could probably adjust this to make clearer what a default drive is, but my bigger concern here is that there’s no actionable information. What should the user do? I can suggest some wording.

I just ran into this in Build as well. This is what we show there @jean. It seems like moving projects might not be in scope but i’m guessing some of the other language could be similar :shrug::skin-tone-4:

Yeah for converse we don't really have the option to move the project. This conversation is essentially a read-only project from the point default drive changes. You can only delete the project I believe.

Thanks for flagging! We have different behavior for build and converse when the default drive changes.
• for build, the user can either migrate the project to the new drive to keep working or delete the project
• For converse, since we can’t support migration yet, we only allow a user to converse with the existing files, but a user can’t add any new files
I agree with the feedback that a regular user might not really know what a default drive is so it may be confusing when they encounter this message. That said, the messages are important as we need the user to make an active choice for build and we also need the use to be aware that they can’t add new files to converse. I’m future, for converse, we will eventually be able to support moving files to new default drive so the option will look like what we have for build. This is technical limitation for right now 

@jean @Rosie it would be great to see if we can propose new copy for both the build notification and the converse notification to make this more clear for the user.
We can do that! I’m focused on other projects today, but I’ll come back to this on Monday and coordinate with @Rosie.
